title: What is "manifesting"? | One Good Answer
description:
From the Vox Quick Hits archives (Jan. 27, 2021): “Manifesting,” or the practice of thinking aspirational thoughts with the purpose of making them real, has never been more popular: From late March to mid-July in 2020, Google searches for the term  skyrocketed 669 percent; “shut up I’m manifesting” was among the defining memes of 2020. Vox's Rebecca Jennings joins host Meredith Haggerty to explain what manifesting is, who's doing it, how it works, and how it doesn't.
Read Rebecca's story here.


Host: Meredith Haggerty (@manymanywords), co-deputy editor of The Goods


Enjoyed this episode? Rate us ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐and leave a review on Apple Podcasts.


Subscribe for free. Be the first to hear the next episode of One Good Answer by subscribing in your favorite podcast app.

itunes:title: What is "manifesting"? | One Good Answer
itunes:author: Vox
itunes:subtitle: The latest internet wellness craze is thinking your way to a better life. Whether it works or not isn’t really the point.
